did.abstract: Perley Baldwin Payne Jr. (1914-2002) served in Spain in 1938 as part of the XV International Brigade, composed of American volunteers fighting for the Spanish Republic against fascism. The Perley Baldwin Payne Jr. Papers contains the diary Payne kept during his service in the Spanish Civil War with entries that date from January to December 1938 that describe Payne's travel, fighting, and injury. This collection also contains a 1936 bullet storage box kept as a souvenir from his time in Spain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Richard Payne in April 2008; the accession number associated with this gift is 2008.022.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: In July 2025 a storage box containing bullets was assessed by the Preservation Department and the bullets were removed. Due to the illegality of possessing live ammunition in New York City, the Preservation Department transferred the bullets to the local police department for disposal. The cardboard container was retained in the collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Perley Baldwin Payne Jr. (1914-2002) was born in Campbell, California, and attended San Jose City College for two years. He worked as an agricultural worker, cannery worker, and truck driver. He served in Spain from February to December 1938 as part of the XV International Brigade, composed of American volunteers fighting for the Spanish Republic against fascism. He returned to the United States in December 1938. Payne also later served in the United States Navy in World War II.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p:
Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2025 are unknown.
In 2025 the diary was placed in an acid-free folder within a shared manuscript box. After consultation with Preservation Lab staff, the bullets found within a cardboard container, which were part of the original donation, were removed from the collection and the container was retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Perley Baldwin Payne Jr. Papers contains a diary kept by Payne during his service in 1938 as a volunteer with the International Brigades during the Spanish Civil War. The diary entries contain brief accounts of Payne's travel, fighting, and injury during this time. This collection also contains an empty bullet storage box which was taken as a souvenir by Payne while he served in Spain.
